actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties

official_title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States providing that the Constitution does not preclude a penalty of death, including when it is imposed for the rape of a child under 16 years of age.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Declares that the death penalty is permitted under the Constitution and does not constitute cruel and unusual punishment, including when imposed for the rape of a child under 16 years old.

titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States providing that the Constitution does not preclude a penalty of death, including when it is imposed for the rape of a child under 16 years of age.
